# Vista Graphics Library The Vista Graphics Library provides powerful 2D drawing capabilities for creating custom graphics, visualizations, and interactive canvas-based applications. ## Graphics Features - **Drawing Primitives**: Lines, shapes, polygons, paths - **Transformations**: Rotate, scale, translate, skew - **Colors & Gradients**: RGB, RGBA, named colors, linear/radial gradients - **Text Rendering**: Text with fonts and alignment - **Image Support**: Image drawing, scaling, sprite sheets - **Animation**: Frame-based animation and transitions ## Documentation Sections - [Concepts](/vista/wiki/graphics/concepts/) - Graphics fundamentals - [Tutorials](/vista/wiki/graphics/tutorials/) - Step-by-step guides - [Drawing](/vista/wiki/graphics/drawing/) - Drawing primitives and operations - [Text & Fonts](/vista/wiki/graphics/text-fonts/) - Text rendering - [Images](/vista/wiki/graphics/images/) - Image handling - [Transforms](/vista/wiki/graphics/transforms/) - Transformations - [Colors](/vista/wiki/graphics/colors/) - Color and gradient reference - [Animation](/vista/wiki/graphics/animation/) - Animation techniques - [API Reference](/vista/wiki/graphics/api-reference/) - Complete function reference ## Quick Start `draw canvas [ pen red fill blue circle 100 100 50 ]` ## See Also - [Vista Core](/vista/wiki/core/) - UI framework - [Getting Started](/vista/wiki/getting-started/) - Quick start guide
